A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of the competition between the kids, and the family tradition and background they shared. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his belief in nature. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the animal, and things seem to be just fine. Well, until they find that one cat has been turned into an unstoppable killing machine, and is ripping its way through the town. Then a sequel inevitably followed starring John Rhys-Davies and Diane Ladd
